newsitem.title: USA: Buchanan says Dole can catch up to President Clinton.
newsitem.headline: Buchanan says Dole can catch up to President Clinton.

text.p: Conservative commentator and former presidential candidate Pat Buchanan returned to the site of one of his most dramatic victories Tuesday to drum up support for Republican nominee Bob Dole.

At an evening rally, Buchanan admitted to differences with the more moderate Dole. "I think that clearly a Republican president with a Republican Congress would be better for America than what we have in the White House right now," he said.
Dole could beat Clinton if he won over dissatisfied voters now giving lukewarm support to the incumbent, Buchanan said.
"I don't believe Dole is as far behind as CNN says," he said. "It's definitely an uphill battle, but I don't think the race is over yet. This is a volatile election. It's a volatile country."
Buchanan said he was happy with the strict conservative Republican platform adopted for the party's presidential campaign.
"The platform, in a lot of its aspects, adopted the ideas that we had advocated," he said.
The commentator declined to rule out another run for the presidency. "You can't talk about four years from now until we know about four weeks from now," he said.

Buchanan's Alaska trip was scheduled in large part to boost the state Senate bid of Jerry Ward, a former member of the secessionist Alaskan Independence Party who is now running for the legislative seat as a Republican. Ward had headed Buchanan's Alaska campaign.
Last January, Buchanan won the state's non-binding straw poll while Steve Forbes finished a close second and Dole had been a distant third.
